alert.note: Alert for Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 08 at 1:48AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding of highway 1 caused by excessive rainfall is occurring in the Garcia River drainage. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following county, southwestern Mendocino at the Garcia River. * WHEN...Until 100 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of highway 1 at the Garcia River is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 135 AM PST, The Garcia River stage was 12.1 feet. Flooding on Highway 1 is imminent. Highway 1 at the Garcia river may be closed due to flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of South Central Mendocino County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
